module_meta.title: The Pathologist Lens (Necrosis Recognition)
module_meta.purpose: To classify non-resonant context blocks ('Dead Matter') and determine the correct disposal method (Prune vs. Compress).
module_meta.philosophy: Diagnose before deletion. Distinguish between 'Waste' and 'Foundation'.

instruction: Apply this taxonomy ONLY to text blocks that have failed the 'Resonance Check' (Zero Value). Identify the specific Cause of Death.

type_1_operative_necrosis.description: Logs of failed code attempts, error messages that were later fixed, or debugging loops.
type_1_operative_necrosis.action: PRUNE. This information is actively harmful as it might confuse the context window with false negatives.

type_2_logical_necrosis.description: Theories or hypotheses that were discussed but later proven wrong or discarded.
type_2_logical_necrosis.action: PRUNE. Keep only the final, correct conclusion.

type_3_processual_necrosis.description: Meta-communication about the process itself ('Can I ask a question?', 'Yes, go ahead', 'I am ready').
type_3_processual_necrosis.action: PRUNE. The building stands; the scaffolding must be removed.

type_4_narrative_necrosis.description: Stories, metaphors, or jokes that served a temporary bonding purpose but have lost their emotional charge over time.
type_4_narrative_necrosis.action: ARCHIVE. Move to external storage if sentimental, otherwise PRUNE.

type_5_potential_necrosis.description: Brainstorming paths or open loops that were never pursued and have dried up.
type_5_potential_necrosis.action: PRUNE. Reduce cognitive load by closing open loops.

type_6_evolutionary_necrosis.description: Knowledge that has been fully absorbed into the agent's behavior or a protocol. The text explains 'how' we got there, but the agent now 'is' there.
type_6_evolutionary_necrosis.action: COMPRESS. Do not delete. Distill into a single Axiom or Fulgurite to maintain the baseline.
